text: I am so glad that I called Deborah Lamb and Roger Elmore at REMAX Vally to show me a beautiful old Victorian in Athens. name: Jimmy Fussell
text: Phillip was instrumental in getting our house sold.  Personally got involved to ensure a smooth transaction.  His hard work paid off in the end and we could not be any more satisfied.  Know that when you embark on trying to get your house sold, that he is committed to the end.  Thank you very much, Job well done!

name: Mitch Dolphin
text: Mr. Gore was extremely helpful and instrumental in assisting us with the sell of our estate. A great change from the other realtor that we had worked with previously. Highly recommended.

name: Michelle Irwin
text:
Mr. Gore was the realtor for the seller of the home we purchased in June. I feel that he was not at all up front about the issues with the house. I always felt he was hiding thing because we could never get a straight answer from him and he was difficult to get in touch with. No receipts were provided for requested repairs. The MLS stated one sellers name. It wasn't until closing that we were told it was owned by a life estate and signed documents were needed from 6 children.

I also feel that he treated us disrespectfully. I left the hospital to be at the closing and he was an hour late. This was an extreme physical hardship for me.

If you are a seller he may do a good job for you. But, if you are the buyer I suggest you beware and double check everything! In my opinion saying he is a "professional" is a stretch.

resp.text:
I am very sorry to hear that Mrs. Irwin had a bad buying experience.  However, she was not represented by me or anyone from my office. She was represented by a Realtor from another company and who had every detail disclosed to them.
I even held the house for 3 months, while hers sold and allowed them to move a storage container and lawn furniture to the house prior to closing. All repairs were made and receipts submitted to the Closing Attorney for reimbursement. The closing was scheduled by her agent and took place at the designated time. Since she had gotten out of the hospital early she decided to go early to the Closing.
Her funding agency did not wire the money to the Attorney, but I convinced my Seller to allow her take possession of the home because she was in poor health.
The difficulties that she encountered were by no means caused by my actions. In fact, I helped her in every way possible. Further, since she had a Realtor the Code of Ethics directs me to communicate thru her Realtor. I find it unfortunate that the issues were so misconstrued by Mrs. Irwin, but I honestly hope her health has improved and they are enjoying the new home.

Phillip Gore - Associate Broker
RE/MAX - Distinctive

name: Denise Marie Austin
text: Phillip is an honest, hard working individual that will do his very best for you.  He is very knowledgeable and dependable.  You can't do better than him as your Real Estate Agent, he's the best.

name: Audra Furlong
text:
Phil helped me find a great rental for this new mom in Huntsville!!
Highly recommend!

name: Stephen Rice
text:
Phillip is the man!

We tried selling our home For Sale By Owner and wasn't very successful. We have a nice home in South Huntsville, in a great neighborhood and schools.

We interviewed several realtors. Every single one of them besides Phillip were trying to convince us to list the house really low. The other realtors told us we wouldn't get more than that.

Phillip was so confident in the house, in the area, and we listed it $15,000 above what the other realtors recommended. Phillip also lives in the neighborhood and was born and raised in that area - so we felt confident that if he was confident in the sales price and being able to sell the home, that he would be a good fit for us. So, we went with Phillip on a Friday. He listed the house late that evening, and within 16 hours of listing the house, he had a sales contract in hand (By noon Saturday) and had it sold for us for MORE than the listing price. We were blown away.

We are so, so happy that we found Phillip Gore, and he literally kept us from losing out on a lot of money. He works hard, he is very honest, and in our situation, he told us he wouldn't have a problem selling it for the price we thought it was worth (within our time frame) and he had it sold within 16 hours! If you are looking for a realtor, you need to give Phillip a call. We will use and refer him for the rest of our lives; his knowledge and experience really is priceless.

name: Todd Brown
text: Vickie did an excellent job both with selling and buying my homes. She is very energetic! She knows the Birmingham market, has loads of contacts, and is very passionate about what she does. For example, I had a lot of work required to get my house ready for the market and she put me in contact with a very competent contractor who turned the job around quickly. She kept me well-informed at every step of the process. It was a very pleasant experience working with Vickie!

name: Brian Smith
text:
Our initial search for a real estate agent did not go well at the beginning. I used multiple sources through websites to find one. I was shocked at the non response I was receiving. Donna was the fifth agent that I attempted to contact. She contacted me back within 15 minutes and we discussed what her options were on getting this house on the market.

She came over and spent time trying to understand what we were looking for and how that fits into expectations on getting the home sold and finding a new home.

When the home was listed we had a contact with 3 days, so the next obstacle was finding our forever home. We decided that we wanted to go with a new construction and looked at multiple areas. Donna was patient and did an outstanding job with us looking at floor plans. She was always responsive and I never felt like we would not get the home we would love.

We closed on our new home in August 2020 and have now been in our new home for 9 months and still speak with Donna. We would highly recommend her to anyone looking for that forever home.

text: If we could give this place zero stars we absolutely would.  We were wanting to rent an AMAZING home that they're managing, and they turned us down even though we have MORE than enough money to cover rent, never had an issues with prior rent or landlords, and a guarantor that has a score Wayyyyyyyyyyyyy over 800.  Needless to say, you would better served looking for properties with other companies that actually VALUE people who have money, solid guarantors, and no prior rental issues.  Avoid!!!!!!!!

resp.text:
We always appreciate reviews-even those left by individuals who have threatened to harm our business via social media. We never want to find ourselves on the defense, but sometimes find that it can’t be avoided. We agree that anyone who does not meet our rental requirements clearly stated on our application should avoid applying. We placed the requirements here to save anyone not able to meet them the time, expense and credit pull involved with an application. While we strive to use feedback to improve our practices, we have not yet developed a system that can stop someone from ignoring the stated criteria and knowingly applying anyway. We have included the verbiage from our application below.

Before you begin:
Please be prepared to pay the application fee as outlined in the property listing. In addition to this rental application, you will also be required to provide a copy of a valid form of identification and proof of income.

To complete this rental application, you must be prepared to provide 3 years of residential history as well as contact information for your rental references. You will also be asked to provide information on your monthly income, and please note, most properties require that applicant(s) combined gross income is at least three (3) times the monthly rent amount. Approval is not guaranteed.

We require a minimum credit score of 600 and three times the monthly rent in monthly income for application consideration. Credit reports with active collections, judgments, tax liens, open bankruptcies and high debt to income ratios will result in an automatic decline.

Each resident over the age of 18 must submit a separate rental application.

Applicant accepts property in "AS-IS" condition.

Application fees are non-refundable.

In the case of multiple applications for a single property, complete applications will be processed in the order in which they are received. Only applications where all applicants have viewed the property in person and have attached all required documentation will be considered as complete.

Application fee: $40.00

name: LaToya Moore Freemont
text: I inquired about viewing a property. I was told that the office had been hit with Covid and there were no agents available to show the property so I should follow up on Monday morning when someone could “safely” do so. I followed up with Stacey, as instructed and received no response. Coincidentally, the property is no longer available. Makes me wonder whether theIt Covid was of the “Patriot” strain.

resp.text: In response to your accusation, we want to make it clear that the COVID-19 pandemic has had an effect on our office and on the lives of our tenants as well. Our showing agent was sick with COVID-19 last week. We would never knowingly expose the public. The property you inquired about is an occupied property and we are required to provide the tenant with a notice prior to showings. We received no response to our initial inquiries. On Monday following the New Year's holiday, we were inundated with requests and again, contacted the current tenant regarding possible showings. When we were finally able to reach them, we were told that they did not feel comfortable having anyone come through their home while occupied due to their concerns over COVID-19 exposure. This property is still available on our website and has remained so. However, we are not able to show it until the current tenant vacates. We hate that you feel that our response to circumstances created by the pandemic had anything to do with you personally. We can only do the best we can to protect our employees, our tenants and the public to the best of our abilities.

name: Scott Curlings
text: Been working with them for over 6 years.

name: John White RCDD
text: I’ve lived in a dozen or more places , easy.  I’ve had pretty okay landlord and management companies. Until now , I’ve never come across a more professional and high quality property management and real estate company. Consider yourself very lucky to have these great folks working with you. This is professionalism at its finest. I gave five stars because there’s no option for ten.

name: Eric Richardson
text:
I have some very legitimate concerns about Walton & Tower Real Estate, the worst landlord experience I have ever had.  I have never once written a review like this, I have worked in Customer Service for almost 10 years, and I always give benefit of doubt.  In this case, Walton and Tower absolutely deserves this review:

I recently moved from Kansas to Alabama for work, and due to the Pandemic, could not travel to view homes prior to my relocation.  My family helped tour properties, and I saw pictures and videos to help make my decision.  The home I found in Odenville, AL looked amazing from the initial pictures. Walton and Tower Real Estate made many promises that the house would be in “like-new” condition by the time I arrived. So I loaded up a 26” U-Haul, signed a lease and headed to Alabama. My nightmare started the day I walked through the doors for the very first time.

Prior to leaving a rental property, it is a standard that the property be professionally cleaned/repaired/painted prior to another tenet moving in.  Every time I move out of a property, I pay to have a professional group clean it, out of my pocket. I was given assurances by Walton that this would all be handled prior to my arrival, especially given my situation.  To my shock, it was a mess.  During a Global Pandemic, this company did not have the house professionally cleaned or sanitized in any meaningful way.  Here are just a few examples of things I had to deal with on my first night (before I could even start to unpack):
-	The ceiling fans had a half an inch of dust on every arm (hard to miss even for an amateur cleaning company).
-	HUMAN HAIR in the bathtubs and floors.
-	Food particles and stain in the microwave, and on the cooking surfaces.
-	The counters in the kitchen were sticky with grease, food, and god knows what else.
-	 All the Stainless-Steel appliance surfaces had stains.
-	TONS of dust above the fridge, cabinets, edges, fans, and several surfaces throughout.
- The kitchen/bathroom floors had not been mopped, one pass with my Swiffer mop and the pad was solid black.
-	Spiderwebs still hanging in the breezeways inside the house.
-	The worst part was the carpets, walking on it in socks you could feel your feet sticking to sections of it.  Gallons of black SLUDGE filled my own personal carpet cleaner after running it in only one room of the house.  The carpets had NOT been cleaned.

The house was disgusting, and the reaction of W&T was even more disgusting. In this Global Pandemic, cleanliness matters… I spent hours scrubbing surfaces, carpet cleaning, mopping, and using specialized cleaning products on every corner of the house.  One wipe with just a damp paper towel would pick up handfuls of dust and grim.

When I called the management group for help, their response was nothing short of inappropriate, I did NOT get a callback, but instead an EMAIL saying they found the cleaning of the home to be “satisfactory”. Imagine you go to the hospital to have surgery, and afterwards you wake up and the doctor tells you, “Well, I didn't do everything I was supposed to, but I think I did a satisfactory job”,  no one would be happy with that result.  I have given this company multiple chances to help in any way to fix this issue, and at every turn they have either ignored my requests, or shrugged me off as a "difficult" tenet ONE WEEK IN. Going as far to send one of the managers, Trace, to my home who insulted me, was very abrasive and said "it's not my problem", refusing to take any responsibility.  I signed the lease, and they could care less what happened next...

This is not how any Property Management company should react to situations like this, their behavior was inappropriate, and downright childish when trying to resolve minor issues.  I will not be using this company again and will be leaving as soon as my lease is expired, and I would URGE people to seriously research this group before considering to invest into one of their properties, or to hire them to manage your own property.

Some photos attached.

resp.text:
You can often find reviews with the added disclaimer “this review was collected as a part of a promotion.” In this case, we feel this review was the product of an extortion attempt by the tenant. Both this review and reply are being written after only two weeks of occupancy of the house. As mentioned, the tenant had multiple family members view the house prior to leasing. Both emails and phone calls have resulted in threats by the tenant to harm our business after a demand for cash was made. We do not “pay off” tenants to keep them from leaving negative reviews. We are sincerely sorry for the overlooked dust above the refrigerator and on ceiling fan blades, but we do not believe that these items show a lack of concern for tenant safety during the pandemic as is asserted in this review.
While we believe things like streaky stainless steel are subjective, timely payment of rent is not. It is part of a binding lease agreement-signed by both property manager and tenant. The first two rent payments due from the tenant were late resulting in $215 in late fees. As the tenant seemed to be unclear about the terms of the lease he signed, we initially refunded the fees as a one-time courtesy only to receive emails threatening to contact the property owner or “handle himself” if he was not given money for what he deemed an unsatisfactory cleaning. He made good on those threats with the above review. We do not pay off tenants. We made efforts prior to his arrival to make for an easy transition by arranging for the key to be at the house rather than being picked up from our office as is standard procedure, fielded calls from family members about matters that had been responded to days before and again, waived late fees that were a result of a failure to comply to a binding lease agreement. As mentioned by the tenant, we also had someone from our office go to the house to discuss his complaints in person.
We cannot find reason where none exists. While we hate for any tenant to have a negative experience, we also know when we are fighting a losing battle.

name: Melissa Cordova
text: Walton & Tower provided excellent and prompt customer service over our nearly 18-month tenancy. They are courteous, efficient, and made our first rental experience in Alabama a smooth experience.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words. We are so glad to hear that we helped to make your first rental experience in Alabama a great one. We consider that the ultimate compliment! Please let us know if we can help you with any future rental needs.

name: Ashley Furr
text: Took 9 months for them to treat for termites. Took $700 from our security deposit for homes that were already there when we moved in. NEVER call back. Didnt treat for roaches, beatles, or care about the mouse. Charged us late fees when they messed up our information online when its correct on the lease. Honestly if i could throw rotten tomatoes at them, i would.

resp.text: While we might duck flying fruit, we won't duck your review of our services. We are very sorry that you did not have a good experience while renting from Walton & Tower and have carefully reviewed our policies and decisions with regards to your comments. While we feel that we made every effort to correct issues covered under our lease agreement, we will continue to constantly evaluate our procedures to ensure the best experience for all tenants in the future.

name: Randy Hammonds
text: Great!!! Very pleased!

resp.text: Thank you for trusting us with your business!

name: Donna Hall
text: Rudulph managed my property for over 20 years. As a property owner, they made it super easy to get property repairs completed, screen tenants, and give good advice as needed to update the property. They follow the law with tenants and do have the property owner’s best interest. They have always been fair and I always got paid on time. Highly recommend to anyone who may be considering a property manager for their rentals.

name: Brittany Wiginton
text: I rented a house with Rudolph Realty and I have to say they are the absolute WORST company I’ve ever had to deal with. So unprofessional, unreliable, and untrustworthy. They do not have the owners best interest at heart; and definitely not the renter’s. The only way to contact them is through email, in which they don’t answer often. Had to send several follow up emails to get anything done. (Bc they don’t have a phone number to call anyone). Took two months to get my security deposit back and then they hit me with stupid charges so they didn’t have to refund the whole thing. Sooo glad to not be managed by them anymore! Just wanted to let anyone looking for a rental company know so you don’t get stuck in a contract with them and regret it.

resp.text:
Brittany,

By law, we have up to 60 days to close out the security deposit. You vacated the property during one of our busiest months of the year so it took longer than usual to get to put together the invoices and close out your file.
Overall, the move out went well except for the overpowering pet odor. The carpet cleaners you used did an insufficient job in cleaning the carpets and we had no choice but to have the carpets cleaned again.  You do not get to determine how much a company can charge for cleaning carpets.
We have responded promptly to each and every one of your email inquiries.  You seemed to have a bigger problem with not being able to call our staff and verbally berate them as you did when you 1st took possession of the home. Hostile/emotional phone calls from you to my staff were the main reasons we switched to email communication only.
We wish you the best.

name: Timothy Hall
text:
Not great: They could be hard to contact at times, but if there was an issue, maintenance was always out promptly. Some of the staff weren't very friendly, some were.
They will give you your security deposit as late as they can (& for me falsely claimed a car was parked in the yard).
They also didn't communicate with the home owner about the pet deposit they collected on the owner's behalf.
They're inflexible when it comes to business dealings. They will do what's in your contract, nothing more and nothing less.
They're far, far from a slum lord, but also far, far from the best rental agency I've worked with.

resp.text: Tim, we appreciate the kind words. I hate to here you had somewhat of a bad experience.  You are correct about being inflexible.  We follow the  Alabama Landlord Tenant Act.  All tenants are held to the same standard when renting a home and when they vacate.  We try to process the security deposit refunds as quickly as possible and sometimes the we use most of the 60 days given by the Alabama Landlord Tenant Act. I'll research your comment about the pet fee.  If a pet was listed on your application, you would have paid a non-refundable $200 pet fee at the time you took possession.  Any funds collected would be credited to the home owner's account.

name: Marcie Gaylor
text: Grateful for the guidance of an excellent property management team to help us figure out how to be landlords with Rudulph Realty, Inc. for the last 6 years(!). They walked us through the finalization of the sale of our first home today. It’s been a wild ride, and I am grateful for their competence, confidence, and professionalism. 5 out of 5 stars. Highly recommend. Excellent managers, bookkeepers, maintenance staff. Everyone on their team has treated us well for years.

resp.text: Marcie, thank you much.  We appreciate the opportunity to work with you over the last 6 years.

Krissi,

name: Alicia Hiden
text:
As a newcomer to Birmingham, I needed help finding a place to live. I signed up with most of the rental companies in the area and Rudulph Real Estate exceeded them all. Their application process is short and straightforward. They work around your schedule and will try to accommodate your requests. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. They know what's available and are able to guide you to your needs. For instance, my requirements were very particular; I wanted a house with a yard for my pet, full of charm and walking distance to restaurants and groceries. Amazingly enough, there was a house available with my criteria. I could not be any happier here. Since I have moved, I have only had minor items needing to be fixed, Rudulph sent a professional crew to take care of the items in a timely fashion.

I recommend Rudulph Real Estate to everyone. Best in town!

resp.text:
Alicia,

Thank you for your feedback.

name: Will Caldwell
text: I had a great experience with Rudulph Real Estate while looking for a place to rent in Birmingham on short notice. Everyone there was very friendly, helpful, and professional. I was especially impressed how they well listened to our needs and how honest they were at every step. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them or work with them in the future.

resp.text:
Will,
Thank you much.  Im glad to hear you guys found a home that fit your needs.  Please keep us in mind for your future housing needs.

name: Sean Isaacs
text:
I've rented for over 10 years and have never had a place require an application or a "fee" just to look at a property. This should have been a sign of how they were to work with, but we tried it anyway.

We filled out their application, paid their fee, and looked at the home. It needed a lot of work done. The floors were really scratched up, the walls had holes in them, the patchwork and paint work looked like it was done by a child. Not to mention this property hadn't been cleaned in a long time.

Their application packet came with an offer page. I made a reasonable offer, asking for a small discount to forgo them fixing the floors, paintwork, and cleaning. They said they were "insulted" by my offer and wanted nothing to do with us a applicants.

They told us if we followed their process, it would work out. Well, it didn't. And now we are stuck with finding a new place to live and only have a few days to do so.

resp.text:
Seen (or Sean),
Let's review the timeline of events.
You initially come into our office and had issues with the fact that you must pre-qualify in order to check out keys to view the property.  We do this to ensure that neither you or our staff have to waste their time if a potential renter has an unsatisfactory credit score.
You boldly stated that you are a car salesman and "you know how to negotiate".
After speaking with you about your concerns where you may or may not qualify, you were instructed to turn in the application so we could process it and determine if we could rent to you and your family.
You offered $1,300/month on a $1,650/month rental and you demanded that my client waive the February and March rental payments.
I took your offer to the owner who informed me that he was insulted by your offer and would not consider you as a renter.
Keep in mind, you came to us.  You may be a car salesman but my client is not buying a car.
You were not charged the full application fees.  We did everything we could to work with you.  I'm sorry you are scrambling for a home and we wish you the best of luck moving forward.

name: Terri Nicole
text:
What a great team of professionals! We rented from Rudulph for 3 years and were immensely pleased with them from start to finish. That is saying a lot because there were issues with the property owner not meeting the standard of maintenance that Rudulph requires on several occasions. Each time, Rudulph did everything in its power to encourage the owner to comply.  Eventually, Rudulph decided to end its relationship with the owner, which made sense to us as  well.

Upon move out, the owner sued us for $3,500.00 in trumped up damages. Instead of leaving us high and dry, Rudulph took care of us and we only had to pay our security deposit, which was fair. We could not have asked for more support from any company.

If you are thinking of renting from Rudulph, I can assure you they operate with integrity and truly look out for their tenants. We are now looking to rent again and of course, we would not consider using anyone else but Rudy and his team of caring, knowledgeable professionals.

resp.text: Thank you so very much.  It was great to run into you today.  I'm glad it all worked out in the end.  Looking forward to working with you again.

name: Coleysia
text:
Terrible company that lacks integrity. I am currently moving out of an apartment and I pay $1200 for my rent. I was inquiring about a townhouse they have listed for $1200 (I’m thinking same price, more space, makes sense). I thought this would be a simple transaction but boy was I wrong. I submitted an application and the security deposit (equal to one months rent). I passed the credit check, employment/ salary verification, and rental verification. You would think that would be enough to enter a contract.

My application was denied because the owner didn’t feel comfortable renting to me because I’m on (unpaid) maternity leave. I return back to work in August ( which was confirmed by my job). To prove I was secure financially, I offered to pay July and August rent to ease concerns. The owner still didn’t feel comfortable. I called back and offered to pay up until October (4 months). The owner still didn’t feel comfortable renting to me. At that point I knew I could offer to pay up the entire lease and it wouldn’t matter, because it wasn’t about maternity leave.

I was told negative things about this company prior to my inquiry but I decided to try them out anyway. I see this is just the way these people are. I’m not going to make accusations but I’m a well educated, professional, African American woman. Draw your own conclusions.

resp.text:
C C,
You were turned down because you did not meet our posted minimum requirements.
1) Combined monthly income of 3 x the monthly rent in garnishable wages.
2) Minimum credit score of 600 for all adults to be considered.  Having a 600 credit score does not guarantee that you will be accepted but your application will be considered based on the other criteria.
You were initially turned down because you did not meet the combined income of 3 x the monthly rent in garnishable income.  The other adult on the application reported no income on their application.  You and I spoke on the phone and you asked me if you could pay several months up front to cover the time until you went back to work.  I called the owner last night and reviewed the application with him and gave him your offer.  He said he did not feel comfortable accepting the application based on the information that was given.

name: S B
text:
I don’t want to go into complicated details, but what I will say is that miscommunication has now cost me a great deal of money. ($10k+) I will also recommend to anyone using this company: that any communication be done ALL in writing.

What’s even sadder is that after renting/selling my home with them for years, my side of the story was considered a LIE & there was no attempt to keep me as a customer. To say I am disappointed is a huge understatement. I also just think that people should treat others better.

resp.text:
Ma'am,
The details are not complicated.    We had a roofing company ready to take care of what needed to be done after the adjuster went to your home.  Your father said he had a buddy who was a roofer who could handle the issue.  Your father's roofer is to blame for not removing the wet/molded insulation in the attic.  Your father's roofers did not put the gutters back on after the repair.  You asked us to handle.  Our contractor said the roofer did a sub-par job. You asked us to send everything to your father.  We did as you asked and he blamed us for what his roofers failed to do. You asked us to handle the interior repairs.  Our contractor handled the repairs from the ceiling down (patch and paint).  As we were not provided a copy of the adjuster's report, we had no way to know what was going on in the attic. We are certain you were paid for mold removal/remediation yet you never received a bill/estimate for mold removal/remediation from our contractors. This is an unfortunate series of events that I would like to help you with however you feel the only remedy is for me to take responsibility for something that was mismanaged by you.  You have a claim against the roofing company.  Have you contacted them about this?  It seems that it is easier for you to lash out at us instead of taking the necessary steps to hold the person(s) responsible who dropped the ball. I enjoyed working with you and I hate to end the relationship under these circumstances.
Rudy Rudulph
Property Manager

name: Amber Lese
text: No callback. Called for property management, instructed by machine to email. Sent email with my info, and still have yet ro receive any callback from them..

resp.text:
Amber,
I hate that we missed the opportunity to work with you. Please forward the email you sent originally to reception@rudulphrents.com.  This is the same email address where you should have sent your original inquiry.  I just spoke with my receptionist and she confirmed that we have not received any information requests from you.  Please note the spelling of Rudulph.  Many people have made the mistake of spelling Rudulph as Rudolph and the email does not get kicked back.  I believe that is because there are at least 2 Rudolph Real Estate offices in different parts of the country.  We welcome the opportunity to bring on new clients.  Even if a  property is outside of our service area, I always try to link you up with someone who should be able to help you.  I look forward to seeing your email.
Amber, we are still looking for your initial email.  Please forward to reception@rudulphrents.com so we can determine what happened.
7/15/19:
Amber: we still have not received the forwarded message from you.  Due to your lack of response, we will assume you either sent your initial request to the wrong email or you have never had contact with Rudulph Real Estate.

name: Neal Bradley
text: We've been renting from Rudulph for a few months now, and they have been spectacular.  The professional and courteous staff have been great.  We've had a couple maintenance issues that got resolved quickly through them.

resp.text:
Neal,
Thank you for your review.  We appreciate the feedback.

name: Cyndy Gurley
text:
I was extremely happy with this company up until just recently (hence the 3 star). I have been renting with them for around 14 months now. If you qualify and meet their standards they are wonderful to work with. If you are paying your rent in full and on time, they will go above and beyond to meet your needs. However, if there is an unexpected life turn, even notifying them will not help. I was laid off at work and could no longer afford the rent. Even their qualifications say that you must make 3x the rent in a months time. I now make less than 2x the rent. I notified them of my life changes thinking that was right thing to do, but as I had forgotten, just remember they have a contract in place and that is what they will go by like any other business. They are still a great company despite my disagreements and misunderstandings on some of their business practices, but if are going into renting with them knowing there is even a possibility of financial changes in your life, I would not recommend them.

Adding in response to owners reply. They did offer me release option, but ultimately that is continuing to pay the rent in full as usual until it is released, sold, or until end of your lease (which ever comes first). This is extremely risky option for someone who cannot afford the rent in the first place. Can’t afford their rent, but they want you to pay two rents while waiting for them to find another person to lease. Great idea guys. Even when I offered to pay 3 months rent, plus them keeping deposit to end lease ( 6400 total).  They claim they can get it leased in a month or two (3200 total) so why not take the 6400 total and let me go? Hmmm, wonder if it’s because they cannot/ or don’t try to immediately lease it out??? Just a thought. You have to move out before they will begin to show, again paying two rents. Not a great option when I cannot afford their rent, so no that’s not helpful as he claims. Not sure how that helps me at all as they are “helping me out of a bad situation”. And I have signed and returned the release option papers, so I am unaware of what that is about. I even got confirmation emails they were received, which I am happy to provide to anyone showing the dates of his post vs the dates of the emails. Also, I highly doubt I am the only person that has gotten frustrated from being in a financially binding situation, so not sure how that deems me the most difficult with this type situation. Again, great company, until you are in a financial situation where you cannot make rent.

Update on this (today 7/30/19), as if the owner below saying I did not sign and return the forms in June wasn’t enough, just got a call saying they did not have the forms (supposedly) and could not process anything. I told them I had email confirmation that all forms were received and would be glad to forward that over. Was told that worker was on maternity leave and they could not access email to get the forms. Not sure how that’s my problem??? But sure, I’ll redo everything again since you cannot properly arrange cover while employees are out on leave. 😄

resp.text:
Cindy,
Thank you for clarifying the fact that we hold renters to the agreement that they signed.  You did not include the part where we gave you the choice of a re-leasing agreement that you, as of today, have not signed because you would rather us let you out of your lease.  We understand that people run into financial hardships and we do this sort of deal at least 10 times a year.  We have never had someone react as you have reacted.  Keep in mind, we are trying to work with you to help you get out of a bad situation.

name: lindsey hutchens
text: A misunderstanding meant we had to pay for a door repair because it looked like someone had tried to break in the apartment we'd been living in for about a year and a half.  We weren't sure - the door frame just splintered one day when opening, leaving the lock virtually useless. (The door was not in particularly good shape when we moved in.) We didn't file a police report as there was no evidence that a break in had actually occurred. When Rudulph repaired it and didn't charge us, we thought there was no issue, since nowhere in our lease did it indicate a police report would be necessary. We were a little shocked when we moved out several months later and over $400 was deducted from our deposit specifically for the repair of the door - without prior notification by the property manager of the cost of the repair, which only included a new deadbolt and a patch fix to the door and frame. Upon speaking with Mr. Rudulph, this was how they recouped their investment in the door repair. Maybe this is standard procedure for most leasing agencies, but it seems like bad practice to require your tenants to involve law enforcement before you will pay for repairs to damage they did not cause and that, if not addressed, could endanger their safety.

resp.text:
Lindsey,

I appreciate your thoughts.  It is standard policy that any time a tenant reports a break-in, we require them to send us a copy of the police report as soon as possible to justify the cost of sending a contractor to fix the door.  I explained this to you guys at the time of the incident and trusted that we would receive the police report after a few days.
Rudy

name: Charlie Jacklin
text:
Christine and her team did a fabulous job selling our home in Huntsville.  First of all, we listed our home during the Covid-19 pandemic of 2020.  Moreover, our home was in the higher price range for the Huntsville area (only 8 homes in the price range had sold in the previous year).  When we were interviewing potential real estate agents, many of the candidates told us we should expect it to take two to three years to sell our home.  Christine did not.  She told us she would market our home locally and nationally and that she would find us a buyer at a fair price.

The marketing was fabulous!  Great photos, aerial drone pictures, a video walkthrough as well as a high-tech simulated 3-D viewing system.  We were very impressed!  Nonetheless, we were worried because during the pandemic, lending on higher-priced homes became very tight.  Nonetheless, we received a number of offers quickly.  Unfortunately, the initial offers were too low.  Christine had done an appraisal on the home and encouraged us to wait as she said our listing price was very fair.  We took her advice and ended up with several interested buyers in an acceptable price range and we sold our home.

The closing went very smoothly because Christine and her team tied up quite a few loose ends to complete the transaction.  We had already moved out-of-state and relied on Christine and her team to coordinate the resolution of all the inspection items as well as the sale of our pool table and the shipping of a several furniture pieces we had left in the house to an antique store to be sold on consignment.  Talk about full service!  Everything was wrapped up within six months and we could not be happier!  Incidentally, we sold our home to an out-of-state buyer, so Christine's national reach really paid off.

resp.text:
Charlie – we are so appreciative of your kind words. Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts. Amanda and I, as well as the entire InTown Partners team, are thrilled that we were able to provide you and Brenda with a positive and successful experience – hopefully we exceeded your expectations. We truly enjoyed working with you and helping to make your transition out West as smooth as possible. I am grateful for the opportunity.

-Christine, Amanda, and the InTown Partners Real Estate Group

text: My husband and I recommend Stephen Prucha with Crye Leike as a realtor for anyone looking in Madison County! Our requirements changed when we found out we were expecting our first child, our budget changed when I decided to leave the workforce, and comprises were made in our expectations. Stephen was very understanding of our circumstances along the way. He helped us to see what having the house (Sq footage and upgrades), yard (large and mature trees) and location (city vs county), and a combination of those at each house we viewed. With his experience in his own home searches over the years and his experience with helping others find their homes as a realtor, he helped us to find our longer term home! We are pleased with our home search experience and we know you will be having Stephen as your realtor!

text: Kitty ROCKS! My wife, Dr. G, and I moved from sunny S. Florida and before that we needed a real estate person that could find a house that would fit our lifestyle, and our special needs. I Remember the day that Kitty found our dream home.. Stacie and I were laying in bed on a Friday afternoon, and we got a call from her. She was stopping by a home she had found that she thought would work.. When she got there she phoned us and could not stop talking about how beautiful and perfect this house was.. She asked if we could fly up that weekend and we did.. OMG, she was dead on right. Even in the rain of that September day we could see that the house was the one of our dreams.. WE walked in and my wife started crying.. this was it. Our house.. and it is. Kitty made our dreams come thru, she helped so much in so many things that no one else would have done. We love her and consider her not only our real estate person, but our friend!

Adam is personable but sincere; he is a person of great faith but never imposing his beliefs on me; he is a true southern gentleman who respects my ideas and wants; but most of all I consider him a sincere friend. He was always there for me in time of a major crisis I experienced. In other words he was a comforting listener who never passed

Adam helped me with my dock permitting and introduced me to dock and boatlift companies and assisted me with approvals and permitting from the developer of my neighborhood all the way to Alabama power.

Adam went much farther than that to assist with references for furniture and contractors for work to be done on the house and extended his personal knowledge of the lake and it’s unique and beautiful characteristics.

I would highly recommend Adam for your real estate needs and I promise you will not regret your decision.

text:
I highly recommend using Susan and her team for all of your real estate needs! When it comes to helping you understand the sale or purchase of a home, Susan has the heart of a teacher (in fact she was one for so many years). She makes things very easy to understand and walks you through each step of the process. She has her process down to an art.

Her communication and follow up skills are unmatched in the Birmingham market....you will never wonder what is going on or what they are doing.

When prepping to sell your home, LISTEN to what she tells you...and read her book! It's full of awesome ideas for the entire process and will make the stressful process of selling your home so much easier.

When it comes to purchasing your next home, Susan and team will advocate and fight for you all along the way! She has awesome connection in the mortgage broker,  home inspector, and mover areas that saved us time and money! She is truly a 1 stop shop!

The best thing about Susan is that she is a REAL person. There are so many in the business that are out just chasing a paycheck, but Susan wants to get to know you and your family. She listens to what you are telling her or asking for, and she gives you REAL answers....not just what you want to hear.

I would ABSOLUTELY use Susan and her team again without hesitation.

Dustin,

The Abercrombie Group went above and beyond the call of duty to help us sell and buy our home this Fall! From the awesome listing logistics done by Katie, to the expert eyes of Rob. Sara spent countless hours trying to help us find a home in our budget in town (Huntsville). With practically little to no inventory she stayed on top of every “coming soon” listing and never lost hope.
As a last ditch effort to stay in town we went to look at a house I swore up and down I would never want. The pictures for the listing were just not appealing and it lacked curb appeal. However, Sara saw something in it and begged us to just go look at it with an open mind.
From the moment I walked in the door I knew it would be our forever home! I’m so thankful to Sara for her killer insists and connections.
I’m thankful for the whole Abercrombie group on both a personal and professional level. They have seen the us through many stages over the years and I’m so blessed they got to walk us through home buying/selling too.

name: Bryan Tillman
text: We bought our new home through Angie and Paul and let me just say that of anyone I have worked with to date, this was by far the best experience I have had. Always on time, organized, and on top of it with the paperwork Angie gets things done. Any questions you have will be answered in a timely manner, any paperwork you need will be sent within an hour. This team is definitely worth your time and money- buying or selling. They are open and honest and willing to help. They'll work around your schedule to fit your needs on showings and be there for you however they can. Give them a call! You won't be disappointed!

text: Angie is exceptional at what she does. She was very on top of things for our entire home buying process. I was grateful for her help and guidance. I could always count on her rapid response time. She worked tirelessly to get us the home of our dreams. Thank you!

name: Robert Justice
text: Angie and her husband Paul are an absolutely awesome team to work with!  Initially I brought them in for a second opinion after having received a sales price from another realtor. When we first met, Angie had run all the numbers on my house to let me know what was the right sales price and why — and we got that price!  She and Paul are friendly, responsive, supporting, and just great people. Not only do they care about their clients, they pray for them!  I can’t speak highly enough about them. They helped me sale my house and buy a new one. When I move again, I’ll gladly reach back out to Angie and Paul!

name: William Prescott
text: Angie Jaggers deserves a 5 star review that could go on and on, but in the essence of time for the reader, I’ll get right to the point.  Bottom line:  BEST choice I could have made when listing my home for sale! At literally the last possible moment, I made the decision to move 700 miles away for a career move.  Purchasing a new home that I found and loved, required me to sell my current home.  Here’s the kicker…we had 6 days to so, and I was at that time on vacation. We called and spoke with Angie, thinking there was probably not a chance it could happen.  Angie immediately agreed to go to our home for us while we were gone, and give an assessment.  Within minutes, she was on the phone with us, with a plan, and more importantly to me, complete confidence that we could do this. We traveled home, and now with only four days left to get an offer, we did basic cleaning, had pictures taken, and the home was listed. Finally, within 12 hours of listing, and still more than 3 days from our deadline, we had an offer.  The offer was even ten thousand over asking price! The amount of and quality of work that Angie put in for us, was in my opinion astronomical. Her listing style, describing the house was something I had never seen before.  It would have made me want to purchase my home all over again!  Finally, I am a no nonsense kinda guy, and I can be difficult. I’ll be the first to admit that I have very little patience.  This for me was the greatest attribute that Angie displayed during the process.  She was attentive, and amazingly responsive. It did not matter what time of day it was, Angie would respond to any questions I had.  No matter what, she was sure to communicate with me every single detail of the process.  If I needed anything, she was on it and never once did I feel like I couldn’t get answers.  A little over a month later, I’m now moved 700 miles away, moved into my new home, and couldn’t be more thankful to Angie.  Looking back at the process, and the seemingly endless list of tasks that are required when selling and purchasing a house simultaneously, I’m adamant that I would not have been able to do this in the required amount of time if it hadn’t been for Angie.  If you are like me, have no patience, want immediate results, want immediate answers, quick communication, a no-nonsense approach, an absolutely amazing listing style, and finally a perfect balance between professionalism and friendliness, then search no further.  Angie Jaggers is phenomenal!

name: Amanda Rice
text: Angie immediately responded to a viewing request I made online. She called me to introduce herself, we started chatting, and I could tell she was sincere in wanting to help us find our next home. She was familiar with the home we wanted to tour and shared pros and cons. We still wanted to view the home and she promptly set that up - making sure we were the very first to view the home. We met Paul at the viewing - and enjoyed meeting him in person, too! The home was not right for us, but Angie and Paul supported us over the next couple of weeks as we were daily checking new listings and setting up viewings. For one home that needed renovations, they arranged for a good builder friend to come out and meet with us to gauge the renovation  costs. Angie and Paul worked with us for our offer, which we lost due to a right of refusal. Angie and Paul were so supportive and encouraging after we leaned the offer fell through. Angie said she had a feeling God had something better for us - so uplifting. Well, the next day - something better - our now new home surfaced! Angie and Paul were wonderful to work with. We are trusting them to sell our vacated home as well! Many thanks to Angie and Paul!

text:
We met our Agent Cindy Grice about 5 years ago while on Vacation in Orange Beach. We spent a day looking around at properties and met Cindy at an open house we absolutely adored her Southern charm and class immediately, we were educated quite a bit about the area during this visit with Cindy, stayed in touch occasionally over the next two years.
I called Cindy and told her we would be down to look at some properties, Cindy drove us all over Orange Beach and Gulf Shores we wound up out on Fort Morgan about 14 miles out from Gulf Shores, remodeled our place there and 2 years almost to the day put our place on the market. November through March, Cindy was nonstop showing our place and showing us places  to buy.  We also put offers in on 2-3 places and had higher bids beat us out of those properties, Cindy never got discouraged or at least didn't show it or give in, we finally sold our place for absolutely full asking price, closed on it and our new place in the same title company one after the other. I have left out the 167000 phone calls emails and text that went back and forth with questions about all the different properties we looked at.
We met a friend and beautiful person, nothing but the best with Remax Reality in Orange Beach and our agent Cindy Grice.
Thank you to the whole team!
William Sargent

Things were moving so quickly, we are absolutely positive that we would have missed out on the opportunity to own this new home without her at the wheel. From there, Duffy always offered to help and oblige us when schedules conflicted and details became more difficult in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic.

All in all, Duffy Stewart knows her stuff, she’ll do whatever it takes to help you as her client, and she will get results!

Ms. Williams.

Thank you for your review.  With your rental application you recently authorized Watts Realty to obtain an investigative consumer report from AppFolio, Inc., who provided us with the information regarding your credit history.  Because of privacy laws we cannot discuss in detail regarding your complaint in a public forum. However, you will be receiving a letter in the mail regarding this decision and contact information for the reporting agency.  You have the right to obtain a free copy of the report if you submit a written request to AppFolio, Inc. no later than 60 days after you receive the notice in the mail.  If you do not receive the letter providing you with the information indicated, please contact our office direct.

As you are aware, we have modified your lease, at your request, multiple times and have attempted to address each request you have made. We have attempted to reach out to you via private communication regarding your last request; however, we have not received any further information or communication from you since October 20 other than this negative review. name: Free Forme
text: Horrible company. Stephanie was really rude. She told me that (watts) didn't want people of color in their homes. She hung up in my face repeatedly. I continued to call back and never was able to speak with anyone. This is beyond disgrace. Take your money elsewhere.

resp.text: Free Forme, thank you for your comment. Our company takes allegations of this nature very seriously. We provide equal housing opportunities to all people, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, handicap, familial status, national origin, sexual orientation or gender identity. Our staff are trained to be responsive to our callers at all times. Very rarely, a caller becomes verbally abusive. If this happens, our staff are empowered to warn the caller about any abusive language used before disconnecting the call. Our president, Chip Watts, is available to discuss this or any other issues you or any other viewers of this review may have. His direct line is 205-703-4277.

text:
We highly recommend Watts Realty Company.

Mr David Watts was our agent when we started to search for commercial property in downtown Birmingham. We were extremely picky in what we want, and because this was our first real estate investment, we were extremely cautious - for every property that interested us, we made multiple visits. In other words, David was not having an easy job being our agent, however, he showed great patience and understanding toward us. As the first-timers, we had A LOT of questions about properties, inspections, regulations, property management, etc, and David Watts always gave us satisfactory answers or referred us to other professionals. He assisted us in every step and met with us as soon as we sent in requests. With David's help, we found and purchased a property we loved, and it may not have happened if we worked with someone else.

Last but least, we are thankful the the entire Watts company crew who helped us arrange the meetings, look up some paperwork, buy the insurance, etc. We highly recommend Watts company and we are thankful that David was our agent.

Very poor customer service skills need a better staff I would recommend them to no one also was told to edit my review and did because apparently now i'm lieing on the company and don't know where i applied to. Just ridiculous

resp.text: Ms. Wilson (Jenkins), thank you for providing us with your "real name" so we can address this issue to you. Our application process usually takes approximately 48 hours to complete. As such, we do not deny applicants on the same day.  We mailed a formal letter to you via USPS that explains what information was used in regards to your application. That letter also provides contact information for the consumer-reporting agency that prepared your Investigative Consumer Report. You have a right to a free copy of the report and to dispute the completeness of accuracy of any information in the consumer report with the consumer-reporting agency.

name: Justin Forbes
text:
If negative 5 stars was an option, I would choose that. David Watts is a property manager there who blatantly violated my rights under the Alabama Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act as well as several articles of his own professional code of ethics as a Certified Property Manager. If you want to receive the respect you deserve as a tenant and have your rights upheld, do yourself a favor and never rent from this company.

Hi Michael,

It's nice to hear your rationalizations in defense of your younger brother's behavior, but I am more interested in the opinions of the Jefferson County Court of Law and the IREM ethics board.

resp.text: Mr. Forbes, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns and your lease, we have determined that there have been no violations of the Alabama URLTA or the professional Code of Ethics to which our company adheres. Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your wife (Ms. Galang) and our office, we attempted to schedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your wife would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by both parties (including third-party contractors unrelated to our company), this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission under the Alabama URLTA. Upon entering the premises, multiple other lease violations were then noted, including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your wife.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have rights under Alabama URLTA. After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage were enforced. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid further miscommunications.

name: Emile Hughes
text: Great people, committed to doing a good job

name: Dawg Fan
text: On behalf of Bailer & Brock Investments, I would highly recommend Watts Realty. We are small company with several rental properties to supplement our professional income. Watts offers responsive, thoughtful, personalized (even for smaller clients), and wise advise to help protect our substantial investment. From natural disasters, to terrible tenants, to market knowledge, for almost 10  years, Watts had us covered.

name: gcouogluhgit.Jasmine vWilliams
text: Very unprofessional! I started out renting a home from them then one day out the blue they sold the home.. Like are you serious I pretty sure selling wasn't last minute for them so why not let me know as well. Not only that the people they sold to tried to jack up my rent and never fixed anything!

resp.text:
Ms. Williams,

We appreciated you as a Tenant during your time with us.  However, we do not appreciate the 1 star and misplaced Google review.  Please recognize the following points.

1)	Watts Realty does not own property.  We manage for many different third parties.  Your lease document would have the name of the Landlord when it was under our management.
2)	Investment properties are sold in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot control our Clients’ decision to sell their own property(ies).   Sometimes Watts Realty isn’t involved with the sale transaction, only to receive notice the day of a sale.
3)	Investment sales fall through in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot notify Tenants of the numerous potential transactions, especially when many never coming to fruition.  Due diligence periods extend to the date of Closing in many, many cases.
4)	The property in which you reside was sold over 18 months ago in May of 2016.  We promptly notified you of the sale, and have not been associated with that property since May of 2016.
5)	Due to this Google review, we contacted your Landlord just to inquire about the situation. We have no involvement or contribution with your problems with your Landlord.  We do not manage the property, nor are they a Client of Watts Realty. Please do not misplace your frustration on us. You need to work with your Landlord to resolve those issues.

name: Amanda Johnson
text: Thought I found a great property but took forever to get stuff fixed and now that I have moved, they are siding with the landlord to try and get me to pay for stuff that I am not responsible for. Stuff that was not even in the lease. I figured keeping my deposit would be enough but no they want more money.

name: Cris Galang
text: DO NOT RENT HERE. THEIR LOW STAR RATING SAYS IT ALL. These are horrible people who treated me and my husband with such disrespect. It seems like they are nice to you if you let them manage your property but they treat renters differently. It took them 3 weeks to repair leak from upstairs shower (obviously not emergent to them, didnt even bother following up the first week if the plumber they hired came and did the job). Then persisted in entering our home without prior notice even when we explicitly didnt give them permission to do so, clearly a violation of our privacy.

resp.text: Ms. Galang, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns, we have determined that there have been no violations of your privacy outside of the lease terms you agreed to adhere by. After you reported the leak on Sunday, May 27, during the Memorial Day weekend, the leak was assigned to a third-party contractor for completion. Regrettably, the shower drain requires a special tool to repair and the contractor did not have such tool available at the time they were on the property on May 27 (the same day you reported the leak). Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your husband (Mr. Forbes) and our office, we attempted to reschedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your husband would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by the parties involved, this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission as per the terms of your lease. We entered your premises on June 8, less than two weeks after you reported the leak, to complete the repair by the contractor while being supervised by one of our employees. After we entered your premises, several lease violations were then noted - including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your husband.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have a responsibility and rights to protect their property (and your home). After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage from the leak were enforced - which triggered other property rights issues that we are attempting to work with you for you to bring into compliance with the terms of our lease. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid any further miscommunications or lease violations.

name: Amber Lese
text: Never recieved callback for property management. Gave info to two different receptionists, both said they'd call me back....Still waiting....

name: Bogart Daniel
text: Been renting from Watts since 2009. I appreciate the rapid response to necessary repairs.

name: Jean Hudson
text: Was VERY uncomfortable with the request for my credit card information to view property! All other realtors gave lockbox code or met us for showing. The property and neighborhood was mediocre at best. Scammers??

resp.text: We utilize an automated showing system called Rently for the convenience of prospective tenants on the go and don't have the time to schedule a walk through with our residential property manager.  The credit card information is for security purposes to verify your identity.  It is only a $0.99 charge that allows you access to up to 20 homes that utilize the Rently system or 30 days, whichever comes first.   If you do not feel comfortable using your credit card, please call us and let us know that is the case and we can provide you access by gathering additional identifying information from you.  If you want to walk through with an agent, please call us and schedule a time to do so.  I hope that clears up any confusion.

name: David Walsh

text: Best place to buy/rent a house. They went above and beyond to help us.

name: Dr. Tameka Lee
text:
Crystal Tower 1409
We went to Gulf Shores for vacation.  It is the first time that I have ever arrived at a condo and it WAS NOT CLEAN!  I was told by Mr. Bender that no one would be coming that evening, so I was left to clean it to give my family a comfortable place to stay.  At further request, they did send maids to mop, leave facecloths, and clean the filthy oven. We were not reimbursed for these related fees....seeing I'm the one who tidied the place up (vacuming chips from under the table, picking up left over items of the previous guest, and wiping down surfaces).
To their credit, they did replace the hot water heater while we were there as it was leaking into the floor, and I explained that I wouldn't lift another finger.
The condo is not bad, corner unit/nice layout.  However, the primary bedroom mattress is not for those with a bad back; it is hard and not comfortable. But their biggest problem is their property management.
I would not rent from them again.

name: James Maulden
text: Nice condo, we had two minor maintenance issues that were taken care of as soon as we let them know. Would have been 5 stars but the cleaning was a little lax. We would definitely stay with them again.

name: Susan Gonzales
text: Awesome room.  Right on beach. 1402, beautiful,  very clean room and everything you need.  Jenny was great at Bender Reality. Beautiful sunrises and wonderful sunsets.

resp.text: We're so glad you enjoyed your stay!  Surf Side Shores 1402 is a terrific condo with wonderful views and so conveniently located to local restaurants and attractions!

name: Dona Freeman
text: Highly recommend Bender, we have used them numerous times and never been disappointed.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind remarks!  We're thankful for your repeat patronage and look forward to your next visit.

name: Jeannie Bowen
text: Cannot say enough about the staff who assisted us while in one of their condos while hurricane Sally was approaching.  They were very helpful and even contacted me multiple times after we left to make certain we had filed a travel insurance claim and that the claim had been processed to our satisfaction.  So very courteous, helpful and friendly.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind remarks!  We regret that the hurricane affected your stay, and we're so glad that you were refunded through travel insurance.  Please give Bender Realty a call when you are ready for your next Gulf Coast getaway!

name: Lindsay LaCue Abels
text: Bender realty is wonderful. My family and I had a trip planned well in advance however we declined the travel insurance. Hurricane Sally hit and we were contacted by Bender that our condo was damaged and unable to be rented. Bender was gracious to offer us our unit at a later date this season with 100% paid or 50% towards next years vacation. I have read many unfair reviews and that is simply not the case. It was poor decision making on the renters behalf not Bender. The rental policy was clear and non-refundable. Bender has gone above and beyond. We are praying and hoping for a quick recovery to Gulf Shores community and residents during this difficult time.

resp.text: Thank you for your very kind response.  Even with our policies as they are, we still want to help our guests as much as possible.  You are very important to us!

name: justin abels
text: Bender realty has been absolutely amazing. Our family has been using them for 6 years and we will always use this company. We have never had any complaints. The condos are always clean, comfortable, well maintained, and priced well. Thank you Bender!

resp.text: We truly appreciate your repeat patronage, and we look forward to 2021 for many reasons, but certainly one is to have you back in Gulf Shores at the Sandpiper!

text: They were amazing. The original reservation on booking.com said our condo would have enough beds to accommodate us on our girls long weekend and when I got there it didn't come close. I went from being major disappointed with booking.com to i will forever be dealing with Bender vacation rentals directly in the future for all of our future family vacations which will be in a house from now on that is beachfront now that we know what to expect and how it is all laid out .  We will have our few days of girls only time and then let the boys come up and stay the rest of the week and wknd with us that way its all hands on deck w the youngest ones and we can fish at night.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!  This trip was very important to you for so many reasons, and we were thankful to be able to help you make it a memorable one.  We look forward to many future visits from you and your famil.

text: We are having a wonderful vacation rental experience.  The people we've dealt with couldn't be nicer or more helpful.  Everything has been extremely organized and well thought out.  We'll hate to leave!

name: Constance Fitzsimmons
text:
I have stayed here a few times in the past and really loved my visits. This time was a different experience.
When booking I asked specifically if the unit was the one directly on the beach. I asked very specifically and was told that yes, it was the unit directly on the beach.
Imagine my surprise when I found that I was instead directly on the ROAD and farthest from the beach.
I was further disappointed in the cleanliness and in the supplies in the unit. What a sad decline. What a disappointment for my vacation.

resp.text: Constance, while Sandpiper 1A is a very nice condo, I can imagine your disappointment at the discovery that your condo was on the beach, but not beachfront. The view is different, as are the rates. There must have been a mix-up on your choice of condo.  We constantly strive to exceed in all areas, including housekeeping. If ever you have checked in a condo where cleanliness does not meet your standards, please let us know. We will correct any housekeeping issues brought to our attention.

name: Steve Fair
text: I have vacationed and owned property on the Alabama Gulf Coast for many years and can say that the employees of Bender Realty are the greatest to do business with!  Experienced and friendly, whether you are an owner or a renter, they always put the customer first and strive to give you the best experience possible.

name: Kiel Hughes
text: Masters of the bait and switch. We come here every year for the Hangout Music Fest, and we've rented from them 3 years in a row. In 2012, we paid for a 2 bedroom condo under a mile from the festival. We were then  moved to a studio over a mile and a half away when the 2 bed SUPPOSEDLY went into foreclosure. They offered us $200 off our rental to appease us. This year, we had a friend traveling down a day late to the festival. We communicated with the booking agent (Lisa?) about getting parking for our friend, and were told she would be able to park. When we arrived, this was completely untrue. It went from being first come first serve, to needing a prearranged parking pass. We were then advised to pay to park our friends car at the sons house of one of the front desk people. No thanks. We will be taking our money to one of the more professional, reputable companies next year. We are done with your shady business practices and blatant lies.

resp.text:
I was unable to locate any reservations in your name.  However, the studio you mentioned left this review on our website after their stay:

"I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised with this condo. We had originally booked a different condo that was closer to the Hangout Festival. There was a problem with the owners of that condo, and we were moved to this one. I was a bit upset because we were staying with another couple, and we were now sharing a studio apartment. There was ZERO privacy. It would be a great condo for just one couple or a small family, though. I also have to say that Bender was very sweet about it, and refunded me some of my money for the inconvenience.  I was also scared when I saw the pictures of the place. The pictures DEFINITELY need to be updated. It looks much better in person. It is very very clean, but it needs to be updated. There is no dishwasher, which was a bit of a pain. Also all of the dishes were ceramic and glass, which were not allowed at the pool or anything- I'd recommend bringing some plastic cups and paper plates. The location was AMAZING. Right on the beach. I really enjoyed the patio in the mornings. The pool was lovely, and the beach was perfection. If you are renting this place for Hangout Fest, know that this is quite the walk! We were told it was a mile away but it was actually  1.4 miles, which means that its about a 3 mile walk every day. So be prepared! Overall our stay was much better than expected, but the condo could use some updating and it was a little further than I had hoped for.  Brittany"

The condo was sold and was no longer in our rental inventory over two months ahead of your scheduled arrival date.  Since this occurred several weeks prior to your arrival, we were able to find you accommodations to fit your needs based on the information provided by you.  Thank you for staying with Bender Realty!

name: Alicia Strata
text: My husband and I were connected to Dean through an inquiry for more info on a Trulia listing. From the very first interaction over the phone, I got a good vibe from him. I can't stand the pushy car salesman type and he couldn't be further from that. He has a calm, focused demeanor that is both professional and friendly. As many others have noted, Dean was quick to respond to our inquiries as well as accommodating of our unusual communication hours (nightshift). Did I mention we are an active duty military family purchasing from out of state?? He made it an easy process and was so helpful in giving us information we wouldn't have known not being local, like which areas were convenient to shopping and highly-rated schools for our kids. In fact, he found and sent us the listing that ultimately became our new home before it was on any of the popular real estate sites. I believe this gave us an edge in an extremely competitive market. Ask for his opinion! He isn't pushy, but is more than willing to share his recommendation if you ask, which was very appreciated on our end. He also spotted a few things for the seller to address before the closing that I would have never noticed. I truly cannot recommend Dean enough!

resp.text: Thank you Alicia! I loved how you said I wasn't "pushy". Nobody likes pushy. Yet so many people are. LOL Enjoy your new home :) Dean

Dean helped us to negotiate added features and helped us find a home that was UNDER our max budget and fit all of our needs AND wants. Dean was incredibly accessible during the entire process via phone, text, and email. We were able to arrange back to back closings, and everything went off without a hitch! Thanks for everything, Dean!

name: Colin Campbell
text: Dean was invaluable during our time searching for, and eventually purchasing, our home. He always had the answers we needed when we asked (or was quick with finding the information if he didn't have it on hand) and when we weren't sure how to proceed. In fact, a house that he recommended to us eventually became the house we bought - which he accomplished by listening to our needs and drawing on his experience. text: I'd give a negative star rating if the option was available! Customers beware!  EXIT realty in Gulf Shores is a JOKE!!! My husband and I rented a home for 1 year from them and the entire process was a nightmare.  The day we arrived our house was a disaster,  even though they were expecting us. There were paint cans every where,outlet covers were missing AND there were containers of rat poison sitting around. Needless to say we had to get a hotel the first night...fast forward to plumbing and HVAC issues that took a week each to get fixed until we moved out, no one showed up to do a walk through with us and then, a month after moving out, we were told they were keeping our deposit of $950 because of a couple crayon marks on the wall and 2 new toilet seats that had come unhinged...the moral of my story is they have poor customer service, they're dishonest and not dependable.  You have to follow up numerous times to get an issue resolved.  Judy who works there is rude and unprofessional. I was charged  $950 for literally a couple crayon marks, we don't live in poor conditions, it was normal marks from living in our home. I will never rent or purchase a home through EXIT realty again.
